revised_title: Spectroscopic Analysis of 8 Cephei Class Variable Stars
tldr: The author investigates the spectra of five variable stars in the 8 Cephei class and finds that they all have identical spectra, indicating a common origin. The stars are found to be increasing in temperature and are believed to be meteor-swarms not yet fully condensed. The study also reveals that there is a general weakening of the continuous spectrum as the light of the star decreases.
